Also known as Purple Line, it primarily runs from west to east with access to the cities of Manila, San Juan, Quezon City, Marikina, Pasig. In 2021, the line extended outside Metro […]

The post LRT 2 Stations List In Order – What Are The LRT 2 Operating Hours, Schedules appeared first on Filipino Guides.
item.content:encoded:
The LRT 2 or Light Rail Transit Line 2, known popularly as the Megatren is a rapid transit line in Metro Manila, Philippines.

Also known as Purple Line, it primarily runs from west to east with access to the cities of Manila, San Juan, Quezon City, Marikina, Pasig. In 2021, the line extended outside Metro Manila to Antipolo, Rizal.

What are the stations of LRT 2? Get to know the route of this line to help you in your trip.

Recto Station LRT 2

Recto LRT 2 Station is the western terminus of the line and located on Recto Avenue near the districts of Quiapo and Santa Cruz in Manila. It is near the Quiapo Church, schools, colleges, and universities. This is the station you need to alight if you need to connect to LRT 1 station in Doroteo Jose.

Due to its convenient location, the area is thriving with a number of businesses ranging from hotels, lodge, motels, diner, eateries, stores, and malls – most within walking distance of the train station. This is the busiest station along the railway line.

Landmarks

  • Isetann Cinerama Recto
  • University Belt
  • QQ Mall Quiapo
  • Odeon Terminal Mall
  • Tutuban
  • Arranque Market
  • Cartimar Manila Shopping Center
  • Fabella Memorial Hospital
  • Divisoria
  • Manila City Jail (Bilibid Viejo)
  • Manila Grand Opera Hotel
  • Raon Shopping Center
  • Puregold
  • Saint Stephen’s High School
  • Chiang Kai Shek College
  • Philippine College of Health Sciences
  • STI College Recto
  • Access Computer College-Manila
  • Arellano High School
  • Philippine College of Criminology
  • University of the East (UE)
  • Far Eastern University (FEU)
  • Quiapo Church
  • LRT 1

Legarda Station LRT 2

The station is located in Sampaloc, Manila, and was named after the Legarda Avenue which is nearby. It is near the university belt with several big schools, colleges, and universities.

Landmarks

  • Legarda Street
  • Mendiola Street
  • San Sebastian College
  • University of the East (UE)
  • Centro Escolar University (CEU)
  • San Beda University
  • Samson College of Science and Technology
  • National Teachers College
  • College of the Holy Spirit
  • Arellano University
  • La Consolacion College
  • Victorino Mapa High School
  • Sampaloc Public Market
  • St. Anthony of Padua Shrine
  • Gothic Basilica of San Sebastian
  • Our Lady of Loreto Parish
  • San Miguel District
  • Malacañang Palace

Pureza Station LRT 2

Pureza Station is located in Santa Mesa, Manila and is so named because it is located near Pureza Street.

Landmarks

  • Polytechnic University of the Philippines (PUP)
  • De Ocampo Memorial College
  • AMA Computer College Manila Campus
  • Pio Sacred Heart of Jesus Parish and Catholic School del Pilar Elementary School
  • Eulogio “Amang” Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST)
  • The Station Point
  • Nuestra Señora de Salvacion Parish
  • Puregold Jr. Pureza
  • Savemore Market
  • University of Santo Tomas
  • AB Liner Inc
  • Pasig River Ferry Service
  • Philippine National Railways

V. Mapa Station LRT 2

V. Mapa Station is also known as Santa Mesa Station. It serves the Santa Mesa, Manila, San Juan, Quezon City, areas. The station is located near the intersection of V. Mapa Street in Santa Mesa, Manila.

Landmarks

  • SM City Sta. Mesa
  • Central Colleges of the Philippines
  • University of the East Ramon Magsaysay Memorial Medical Center (UERM)
  • Immaculate Heart of Mary College
  • Mezza Residences

J. Ruiz Station LRT 2

The station is located in San Juan and was named for its location on J. Ruiz Street. It is San Juan’s only train station and is located near the Quezon City border before entering Manila.

Landmarks

  • N. Domingo Street
  • San Juan City Hall
  • Pinaglabanan District
  • San Juan Medical Center
  • Pinaglabanan Shrine
  • St. John the Baptist Church

Gilmore Station LRT 2

Gilmore Station is located near Gilmore Avenue in Quezon City in Mariana, Quezon City.

Landmarks

  • Saint Paul University Quezon City
  • Saint Joseph’s College of Quezon City
  • St. Luke’s Medical Center
  • Robinsons Magnolia
  • SYKES Asia, Inc. (K-Pointe site)
  • Aurora Garden Plaza
  • Gilmore I.T. Center
  • San Juan and Greenhills Shopping Center
  • Broadway Centrum
  • Sen. Jose O. Vera Street (Granada Street)
  • Our Lady of Mount Carmel Parish
  • Xavier School and Immaculate Conception Academy-Greenhills
  • Trinity University of Asia

Betty Go-Belmonte Station LRT 2

Beti Go Belmonte Station is in New Manila, Quezon City and is named after Beti Go Belmonte. This station is considered one of the least-used on the line.

Landmarks

  • Holy Buddhist Temple
  • Cubao Cathedral
  • Religious of the Virgin Mary Motherhouse
  • Kalayaan College

Araneta Center–Cubao Station LRT 2

Araneta Center Cubao Station, or simply Cubao Station, is in Cubao, Quezon City and named after the old name of Araneta business district.

Araneta Center-Cubao Station is considered as a main terminus of this line and one of the busiest station in LRT 2.

If you need to transfer to MRT 3, this is the station you need to alight.

Landmarks

  • Araneta City
  • Gateway Mall
  • Ali Mall
  • Farmers Plaza
  • Araneta Center Complex
  • Smart Araneta Coliseum
  • Project 5 Barangay E. Rodriguez
  • Diamond Arcade
  • Cubao Elementary School
  • MRT 3

Anonas Station LRT 2

Anonas Station is located in Cubao, Quezon City and named for its proximity to Anonas Street.

Landmarks

  • Technological Institute of the Philippines
  • Saint Joseph Catholic School
  • Saint Joseph Parish
  • World Citi Medical Center
  • Hi-Top Supermart
  • Anson Supermart
  • Anonas City Center

Katipunan Station LRT 2

Katipunan Station is located on Katipunan Avenue, one of Quezon City’s main thoroughfares. The street is named after the revolutionary group Katipunan.

The train station is located at Loyola Heights in Quezon City. It is the only station underground on the entire line.

Landmarks

  • Katipunan Avenue
  • Philippine School of Business Administration
  • Ateneo de Manila University
  • Miriam College
  • University of the Philippines Diliman

Santolan LRT 2 Station

Santolan station is on the Marikina-Infanta highway in Marikina, near the Pasig border. From 2003 to 2021, the Santolan station was the eastern terminus of the line. It is the only station on this line that has an island platform.

Landmarks

  • Marikina River
  • BFCT East Metro Manila Transport Terminal
  • College of Arts and Sciences of Asia and the Pacific Marikina
  • Bali Oasis
  • SM City Marikina
  • Riverbanks Center

Marikina Station LRT 2 – Marikina Pasig Station

Marikina Pasig Station is near the three-point boundary between Pasig, Metro Manila, and Cainta, Rizal.

The station is located on the Marikina-Infanta Highway section near the intersection of Felix Avenues and Gil Fernando.

This line is the last stop in Metro Manila before heading to Antipolo. This one of the new new LRT 2 stations

Landmarks

  • Sta. Lucia East Grand Mall
  • Robinsons Metro East
  • Ayala Malls Feliz
  • Sta. Lucia Residences
  • Barangay San Roque in Marikina
  • S&R Marikina
  • Marquinton
  • Marikina Sports Complex
  • Gil Fernando Avenue
  • APT Studios
  • Tropicana Garden City
  • Blue Wave Mall
  • Marikina City Hall
  • Sienna Tower Residences
  • Marcos Highway

Antipolo Station LRT 2

Antipolo Station is located in Antipolo, Rizal and is the eastern terminus of the line. The easternmost station on the line, which opened on July 5, 2021, is a new LRT 2 station and is located near the Sumulong Expressway junction of the Marikina Infanta Expressway. This is the first station on the LRT system outside of Metro Manila.

Landmarks

  • SM City Masinag
  • City Proper of Antipolo
  • Diocesan Shrine and Parish of St. Therese of the Child Jesus
  • Cornel Medical Center
  • Metro Antipolo Hospital and Medical Center
  • East Gate Business Center
  • Vermont Park Executive Village
  • Kingsville Executive Village
  • Golden Meadows Executive Village
  • Filinvest East Homes

LRT 2 FAQs

Here are some of the common queries by commuters on LRT 2 Stations

What are the LRT 2 Fares?

Following is a table of LRT 2 Fare Matrix.

How to go from LRT 2 to LRT 1?

If you’re coming from LRT 2 and need to go to LRT 1, you can do so via ‘Recto LRT 2 Station’, then to ‘Doroteo Jose LRT 1 Station’.

There’s no direct lrt 1 and lrt 2 connection, so you need to walk to LRT-1 Doroteo Jose Station.

How to go from LRT 2 to MRT 3?

If you need to go to MRT 3 station, you need to alight at the Araneta Cubao LRT 2 Station. You need to enter the connection on the Gateway Mall and then walk towards the pathway to Farmer’s Plaza which has a connection to MRT 3 Araneta Station.

What’s the LRT 2 last trip – LRT 2 closing time?

LRT 2 have different schedules on weekdays, weekends and on some holidays.

  • From Mondays to Fridays, the last trip is usually on 10pm.
  • On Saturdays and Sundays, the closing time is mostly at 9:30pm.

On holidays, the last train is usually at 9:30pm, though there are occasions they change the time or don’t operate for maintenance. They post the schedules for specific holidays on the LRT 2 stations itself or on their official Twitter account: https://twitter.com/OfficialLRTA.

The post LRT 2 Stations List In Order – What Are The LRT 2 Operating Hours, Schedules appeared first on Filipino Guides.

item.title: MRT 3 Stations – Route Of Metro Rail Transit Line 3 In Metro Manila Philippines
item.dc:creator: Admin
item.description:
Are you planning to navigate Metro Manila? Look no further than the Metro Rail Transit Line 3, also known as the MRT Line 3, MRT-3 or Metrostar Express. This light rapid transit system is a convenient and reliable mode of transportation if you’re looking to explore the major cities in NCR. The MRT Line 3 […]

The post MRT 3 Stations – Route Of Metro Rail Transit Line 3 In Metro Manila Philippines appeared first on Filipino Guides.
item.content:encoded:
Are you planning to navigate Metro Manila? Look no further than the Metro Rail Transit Line 3, also known as the MRT Line 3, MRT-3 or Metrostar Express. This light rapid transit system is a convenient and reliable mode of transportation if you’re looking to explore the major cities in NCR.

The MRT Line 3 follow the alignment of Epifanio de los Santos Avenue (EDSA). This line is unique in its combination of light rail and rapid transit features, providing a smooth and seamless journey for its passengers.

With total grade separation and high passenger output, the MRT Line 3 is the choice for travelers looking to get around the Metro. It’s route and station stops allows you to access the cities of Pasay, Parañaque, Makati, Taguig, Mandaluyong, Pasig, San Juan, Manila, and Quezon City.

In this post, we will be providing a comprehensive list of train stations located on the MRT Line 3 for your convenience. From north to south, we will be detailing all the stops, making it easier for you to plan your itinerary and make the most out of your trip to Metro Manila.

North Avenue MRT 3 Station

North Avenue MRT 3 station is in the neighborhood of Diliman, Quezon City. It sits at the intersection of two major thoroughfares, EDSA and North Avenue.

As the northernmost stop on the line, it serves as the North Terminus of MRT Line 3.

The station is just steps away from TriNoma, and in close proximity to SM City North EDSA.

Landmarks:

  • TriNoma
  • SM City North EDSA
  • SM Cyber West Avenue
  • Ayala Malls Vertis North
  • Veritas Tower
  • Philippine College of Surgeons
  • UNTV Broadcast Center
  • Triangle Park
  • Veterans Memorial Medical Center
  • Vertis North
  • Philippine Science High School Main Campus
  • Quezon City Science High School
  • Ninoy Aquino Parks & Wildlife Center
  • Philippine Medical Association secretariat
  • Phil-Am

Quezon Avenue MRT 3 Station

Conveniently located in the heart of Diliman, Quezon City is the Quezon Avenue MRT station. From the station, you can ride a jeep to Quezon Memorial Circle, Quezon City Hall, Triangle Park, and UP Diliman.

Landmarks:

  • PAGASA Complex
  • Quezon City Hall
  • Office of the Ombudsman
  • Quezon Memorial Circle
  • Triangle Park
  • Court of Tax Appeals
  • ABS-CBN
  • Lung Center of the Philippines
  • Centris Walk Shopping Centers
  • UP Diliman

GMA Kamuning MRT 3 Station

Located near bustling establishments in Scout Triangle and Timog Avenue in Diliman, Quezon City is the GMA-Kamuning MRT station. The station is just a walking distance to Kamuning Road, the GMA Network Center and close to the Victoria Sports Tower.

Landmarks:

  • Kamuning Road
  • GMA Network Center
  • Timog Avenue
  • Scout Triangle
  • Victoria Sports Tower
  • Department of Public Works and Highways
  • Anchor Tower
  • Quezon City 2nd District Engineering Office
  • Land Transportation Office
  • Philippine Statistics Authority
  • Quezon Memorial Circle
  • Philippine Heart Center
  • East Avenue
  • Quezon City Hall (in Triangle Park)

Araneta Center Cubao MRT 3 Station

Araneta Center Cubao MRT 3 Station is a busy transportation hub in Quezon City, Philippines, serving as a transfer point for commuters using the Manila Metro Rail Transit System Line 3.

You should alight in this station if you need to use LRT 2 Megatren that has the Recto to Antipolo route. You can follow the pathway that goes to Gateway Mall which has connection to LRT 2 purple line.

The station provides convenient access to various shopping, dining, and entertainment options at the nearby Araneta Center. It also has connections to other modes of transportation like provincial buses going to northern Luzon and jeepneys plying the Quezon City, Manila and Rizal route.

Landmarks:

  • Quezon Avenue
  • Araneta City
  • LRT Line 2
  • Farmers Plaza
  • Aurora Boulevard
  • Gateway Mall
  • Kalayaan Avenue
  • Ali Mall

Santolan MRT 3 Station

Santolan MRT 3 Station located in EDSA is surrounded by major landmarks such as Santolan Road, Camp Aguinaldo and Camp Crame. The station allows convenient travel to those looking to go to Libis Quezon City, San Juan, and Manila.

Landmarks:

  • Santolan Road
  • Armed Forces of the Philippines
  • Department of National Defense Headquarters
  • Camp Aguinaldo
  • Camp Crame
  • Philippine National Police Headquarters
  • AFPLSAI Building (inside Camp Aguinaldo)
  • V.V. Soliven Building
  • Greenhills Shopping district
  • Greenhills North/Northeast villages
  • Barangay Wack-Wack Greenhills

Ortigas MRT 3 Station

Ortigas MRT 3 Station is situated in the Ortigas Business District and is surrounded by renowned landmarks such as the Asian Development Bank, Ortigas Center, POEA, EDSA Shrine, and SM Megamall.

Landmarks:

  • Ortigas Avenue
  • Ortigas Business District
  • Saint Pedro Poveda College
  • SM Megamall
  • Robinsons Galleria
  • La Salle Green Hills
  • Asian Development Bank
  • EDSA Shrine
  • The Podium
  • Meralco Theater
  • St. Francis Square Mall
  • The Medical City
  • San Miguel Corporation
  • Philippine Overseas Employment Administration (POEA)
  • Securities and Exchange Commission
  • Crowne Plaza
  • Holiday Inn
  • Oakwood Premier

Shaw MRT 3 Station

Shaw MRT 3 Station is considered as the central station of MRT Line 3 and it is located in Shaw Boulevard, Mandaluyong.

It connects to Shangri-La Mall, Starmall, and Greenfield District. The station is right in the intersection of the EDSA-Shaw Flyover, making it a convenient location for both shopping and traveling. There are jeepneys that can take you to Pasig City or to Quiapo, Manila.

Landmarks:

  • Shaw Boulevard
  • Shangri-La Plaza
  • Greenfield Business Districts
  • Ortigas Center
  • Wack Wack Golf and Country Club
  • Capitol Commons
  • Astoria Plaza
  • Lourdes School of Mandaluyong
  • University of Asia and the Pacific
  • Department of Education
  • San Miguel Corporation
  • Eurotel
  • Cityland Grand Central
  • SM Megamall
  • EDSA Shangri-La Hotel
  • Starmall EDSA
  • Pavilion Mall (formerly EDSA Central)
  • CNN Philippines

Boni MRT 3 Station

Boni MRT Line 3 Station is in Pioneer, Mandaluyong City and has access to SM Lightmall and SMDC Light Residences. You should alight in this station if you need to go to Capitolio, Pasig or to the Mandaluyong City Hall.

Landmarks:

  • Boni Avenue
  • Light Mall
  • SMDC Light Residences
  • TV5 Media Center
  • Rizal Technological University
  • Pioneer Woodlands Condominium
  • Paragon Plaza Building
  • Philippine Red Cross
  • Globe Telecom Plaza
  • Robinsons Cybergate
  • Forum Robinsons
  • Go Hotel

Guadalupe MRT 3 Station

Guadalupe MRT 3 Station is connected to Guadalupe commercial complex in Makati City. The station is near the Guadalupe Bridge. Landmarks nearby include the Rockwell Center, and San Carlos Seminary. You need to alight in this station if you need to go to Makati City Hall (via jeepney in JP Rizal). It’s also the station you need to alight if you need to go to Pateros.

Landmarks:

  • Guadalupe Commercial Complex
  • Rockwell Center
  • Power Plant Mall
  • University of Makati
  • Makati City Hall (via J. P. Rizal Avenue)
  • Nuestra Señora de Gracia Church
  • Loyola Memorial Chapels & Crematorium
  • Guadalupe Nuevo Cloverleaf Park
  • San Carlos Seminary
  • Our Lady of Guadalupe Minor Seminary

Buendia MRT 3 Station

Buendia MRT 3 Station is in Buendia Avenue, Makati City. You can ride a jeepney to go to Makati Business District and Paseo De Roxas.

Landmarks:

  • Buendia Avenue
  • Forbes Park
  • Banco de Oro Head Office
  • Jupiter Street
  • Department of Energy
  • Department of Trade and Industry
  • Urdaneta Villages
  • Makati Avenue
  • Bel-Air
  • Development Bank of the Philippines Head Office
  • Metrobank Head Office
  • Makati Medical Center
  • Makati Central Business District

Ayala MRT 3 Station

Ayala MRT 3 Station is in the heart of the bustling Ayala Center commercial district and the Makati Business District.

It connects to SM Makati and Glorietta Malls. Forbes Village is nearby. Five star Hotels is within the vicinity.

If you need to go to BGC (Bonifacio Global City) or Market Market, you can ride the BGC bus when you exit in the North side.

Landmarks:

  • Ayala Avenue
  • Glorietta Malls
  • Ayala Center
  • SM Makati
  • The Landmark
  • Rustan’s
  • Greenbelt
  • Makati Central Business District
  • Forbes Park
  • Ayala Museum
  • Ayala Triangle Gardens
  • Urdaneta villages
  • Bonifacio Global City (via McKinley Road)
  • Standard Chartered Bank Philippines Head Office
  • Bank of the Philippine Islands
  • Peninsula Manila
  • Citibank Philippines Head Office
  • Hotel Celeste
  • Crown Regency Hotel
  • HSBC Philippines Head Office
  • Asian Institute of Management
  • Makati Diamond Hotel
  • Apartment Ridge row
  • China Bank Head Office
  • Astoria Greenbelt
  • Dasmariñas village
  • Dusit Thani Manila
  • Ascott Makati
  • Jinjiang Inn Makati
  • Makati Shangri-La Hotel
  • Filipinas Heritage Library
  • Holiday Inn & Suites Makati

Magallanes MRT 3 Station

Magallanes MRT 3 Station is right in the intersection of EDSA and South Luzon Expressway. The station is surrounded by landmarks such Magallanes Center, Ecology Village, and Dasmariñas Village

Landmarks:

  • South Luzon Expressway
  • Colegio San Agustin-Makati
  • Asia Pacific College
  • Makati Cinema Square
  • Alphaland Southgate Mall Tower
  • Chino Roces Avenue
  • Don Bosco Technical Institute
  • Levi’s Head Office
  • San Lorenzo Place Mall
  • Makati Hope Christian School
  • GlaxoSmithKline Head Office
  • Assumption College
  • Teleperformance
  • Magallanes Center
  • Ecology Village
  • Dasmariñas Village

Taft MRT 3 Station

Taft MRT 3 Station is the South Terminus of MRT Line 3 and in the intersection of Taft Avenue and EDSA.

If you need to go to establishments in Taft Avenue, you can take the LRT Line 1 Station nearby, which have stops in the DFA Head Office, De La Salle University, UP Manila, Luneta Park, Manila City Hall, Quiapo Church, and University Belt.

The Taft MRT Line 3 Station provides convenient stopover for those going and coming from NAIA, the country’s international airport. Nearby landmarks include the Baclaran Church and SM Mall of Asia.

Landmarks:

  • Taft Avenue
  • LRT Line 1
  • Ninoy Aquino International Airport (via NAIA Expressway)
  • Baclaran Church
  • Metropoint Mall Saver’s Square
  • Heritage Hotel
  • Bay City
  • Manila Tytana College (Manila Doctors College)
  • SMX Convention Center
  • SM Mall of Asia
  • San Juan de Dios Hospital and College
  • Victory Liner Bus Terminal
  • Mall of Asia Arena

item.content:encoded:
Apple iPad Price And Specs In the Philippines. What you should know about the best iPad for you.

The Apple iPad has been dominating the tablet market around the world. Although it has been a big success in the US and Europe, the iPad price in the Philippines still remains to be competitive.

With the availability of different variations of iPad now in the Philippines, what are the specs to look in a new Apple tablet? What are the best price ranges for the new iPad? Find the answers to these questions in this post.

We will share here the price and specs of the Apple iPad in the Philippines.

Apple iPad Prices And Specifications In The Philippines

Following are iPad price and specs available right now

Apple iPad Wi-Fi (9th Gen, Late 2021)

  • Gorgeous 10.2-inch Retina display with True Tone
  • A13 Bionic chip with Neural Engine
  • 8MP Wide back camera, 12MP Ultra Wide front cam
  • 256GB storage
  • Stereo speakers
  • Touch ID for secure authentication on Apple Pay
  • Up to 10 hours of battery life
  • Lightning connector for charging and accessories
  • Works with Apple Pencil and Smart Keyboard
  • iPadOS 15 is powerful, easy to use, and OS designed for iPad
  • 1x iPad
  • 1x USB-C to Lightning Cable
  • 1x 20W USB-C Power Adapter
  • ₱22,490 – ₱31,890

Apple iPad Air (5th Gen, 2022)

  • 10.9-inch Liquid Retina display
  • 8-core GPU delivers graphics, twice faster than previous generation
  • Neural Engine with 16-core design for advanced machine learning
  • Immersive all-screen design
  • Five colorful finishes
  • Strong, light, durable enclosure
  • 100% recycled aluminum
  • Full lamination, P3 wide colour
  • Antireflective coating
  • True Tone adjusts colour temperature on ambient lighting
  • Up to 10 hours of battery life
  • Wi-Fi 6

  • Connects to cameras, hard drives, docks

  • 1x USB-C Charge Cable
  • 1x 20W USB-C Power Adapter
  • ₱49,890

Apple iPad Mini Wi-Fi (6th Gen, Late 2021)

  • 8.3-inch Liquid Retina display with True Tone and wide color
  • A15 Bionic chip with Neural Engine
  • iPadOS 15 powerful OS for iPad
  • Touch ID for secure authentication on Apple Pay
  • 12MP Wide back camera, 12MP Ultra Wide front camera with Center Stage Purple, starlight, pink, and space gray

  • 10 hours of battery life
  • USB-C connector for charging and accessories
  • Works with Apple Pencil
  • 1x iPad mini
  • 1x USB-C Charge Cable,
  • 1X 20W USB-C Power Adapter
  • ₱32,890 – ₱42,890

Apple iPad Pro 11″ Wi-Fi (3rd Gen, Early 2021)

  • 11-inch Liquid Retina display
  • Apple M1 chip for next-level performance
  • iPadOS powerful, intuitive OS designed for iPad
  • ProMotion, True Tone P3 wide color

  • Ultrafast Wi-Fi 6
  • Thunderbolt port for fast external storage and docks
  • Face ID for secure authentication
  • Four speaker audio and five studio-quality microphones

  • Connects to Magic Keyboard, and Smart Keyboard Folio
  • Over a million apps on the App Store just for iPad
  • 1x iPad Pro
  • 1x USB-C Charge Cable (1 meter)
  • 1x 20W USB-C Power Adapter
  • ₱68,790

Apple iPad Pro 12.9″ Wi-Fi (5th Gen, Early 2021)

  • 12.9-inch
  • iPadOS 14
  • Liquid Retina XDR display, 1600 nits of peak brightness
  • 1,000,000:1 contrast ratio
  • ProMotion automatically adjusts display refresh rate

  • 8-core CPU with up to 50 percent faster, 40 percent faster graphics Solid performance for intensive apps and workflows

  • 16-core design for advanced machine learning

item.content:encoded:
Lenovo is one of the most successful laptop brands in the world. It is best known for its sleek, stylish laptops. However, some of its laptops can be expensive depending on the model and specifications.

With Lenovo’s new computer line-up, you can now get your hands on some awesome Lenovo laptops. Let’s take a look at what Lenovo laptops are available in the Philippines.

In this post, I’ll give you a brief overview about the Lenovo Laptop Price and Specs in the Philippines.

 

Lenovo Laptop Specs And Price List

Following are the latest Lenovo laptop prices and specifications in the Philippines

Lenovo IdeaPad 3 14IML05 | Intel Pentium | 4GB RAM 256Gb SS | 14″ HD Windows 11 Home

  • Windows 11 Home

How Much Is Lenovo i3 In Philippines?

The Lenovo IdeaPad 3 Core i3-1115G4 256GB 15.6in is priced ar around ₱24,995. This model is currently the best value for your money in the Philippines.

The IdeaPad 3 is one of the top laptop model with its powerful Core i3-1115G4 processor and generous 256GB of storage. Whether you’re a student, professional, or simply in need of a versatile and dependable computer, the IdeaPad 3 is sure to impress.

Many people are choosing the Lenovo IdeaPad 3 as their go-to laptop!

Is Lenovo Laptop Good Or HP?

While both Lenovo and HP offer a range of high-quality laptops, Lenovo has a strong reputation for producing durable and reliable machines with excellent performance. Lenovo laptops often feature innovative design elements and user-friendly interfaces. Ultimately, the choice between a Lenovo or HP laptop comes down to personal preference, price, and specific needs.

If you’re seeking a brand that offers exceptional value for your money, we recommend Lenovo. With a reputation for quality and affordability, Lenovo laptops are an excellent choice for anyone in the market for a new computer.

Which Lenovo Is Best For Students?

If you’re a student, look into the following Lenovo laptop models:

  • ThinkPad E14 Gen 4 (14, Intel)
  • IdeaPad Slim 3i 11th Gen (15, Intel)
  • IdeaPad Slim 5i 12th Gen (15, Intel)
  • ThinkBook 14 Gen 2 (14, Intel)
  • IdeaPad Flex 5 Gen 7 (14, AMD)
  • Yoga Slim 7i Pro 11th Gen (14, Intel)

Is Lenovo A Good Brand Of Laptop?

Well yes! Lenovo is widely regarded as one of the best laptop brands on the market today. Whether you’re a student, professional, or simply in need of a reliable computer for personal use, Lenovo has a laptop that will meet your needs. And if you’re looking to buy a Lenovo laptop in the Philippines – there are great options available at competitive prices.

Is Lenovo Laptop Good For College?

Lenovo laptops are an excellent choice for college students looking for a reliable and affordable computer. Look into the Lenovo IdeaPad 3, which is widely regarded as the best budget laptop for college in 2021. With its AMD Ryzen 5000-series CPUs, the IdeaPad 3 can handle most general productivity tasks like word processing, web browsing, and video playback with ease.

Additionally, Lenovo laptops are known for their durability and long battery life, which makes them ideal for students who are always on the go. Whether you’re attending lectures, studying in the library, or working on group projects with your classmates, a Lenovo laptop is a smart choice that won’t disappoint.

How Long Does A Lenovo Laptop Last?

Typically, a Lenovo laptop will last for at least four to five years from the time you bought it. While it is possible for a laptop to last up to 8 to 10 years, this is the limit for any device taking into account the hardware, software, support and your use.

item.content:encoded:
ASUS is a multinational company that was founded in 1989. It is well-known for producing the highest-quality laptops, personal computers, monitors, graphics cards, routers, and other technology solutions. ASUS motherboards are widely considered to be the best in the world.

As of January 2021, Asus was the fifth largest personal computer (PC) vendor in the world based on unit sales. The “InfoTech 100” list that BusinessWeek compiles includes Asus.

ASUS Chairman Jonney Shih showed off a limited-edition series of devices to celebrate the company’s 30th anniversary.

In 2019, Asus released the ZenBook S13 UX392, the world’s first ultrabook with the thinnest bezels, a 97 percent screen-to-body ratio, and discrete graphics powered by the NVIDIA GeForce MX150.

Asus is a Taiwanese multinational company that specializes in the production of computer and phone hardware, as well as other consumer electronics. Their headquarters are located in the Beitou District of Taipei, Taiwan.

Desktop computers, laptops, notebook computers, mobiles, networking devices, displays, wi-fi modems, projectors, chipsets, videocards, optical drives, cd-roms, adapters, wearable tech, virtual machines, workspaces, and tablets are some of the products that Asus manufactures and sells.

According to their website, the name Asus comes from the mythological winged horse Pegasus, who is associated with Greek mythology. To get a high spot in alphabetical lists, the name was shortened so that only the last four letters of the word were used.

Asus Laptop Models

Following are current Asus product lineup for laptops.

  • ZenBook
  • VivoBook
  • ASUSPRO
  • ExpertBook
  • ProArt StudioBook
  • TUF Gaming
  • Republic Of Gamers (ROG Gaming)
  • Chromebook

Asus Gaming Laptops

Asus features two popular gaming product lines: ROG and TUF.

ROG – Republic Of Gamers

Since 2006, Asus has been marketing “ROG or Republic of Gamers for a variety of products, including computer hardware, laptops, peripherals, and accessories, with the primary focus being on personal computer gaming. The line features high-end laptops in addition to conventional desktop computers.

TUF – The Ultimate Force

Since 2010, Asus has been marketing the brand “TUF or The Ultimate Force.” Asus more affordable and mid-range gaming products are sold under the TUF Gaming brand.

item.content:encoded:
Acer Laptop Philippines are manufactured by Acer Inc, a company in Xizhi, New Taipei City. It is a Taiwanese multinational hardware and electronics firm focusing on advanced electronics technology.

The company sells laptop PCs that includes clamshells, 2-in-1s, Windows, and Chromebooks.

As of January 2021, Acer was the world’s sixth-largest PC seller by unit sales.

Acer also sells other tech devices like desktop computers, smartphones, mobile accessories, computer peripherals, PC tablets, display monitors, servers, storage devices, virtual reality devices.

Their one of the popular brands selling gaming PCs under their Acer Predator brand.

Acer laptop models include the following :

Acer Aspire – Their cheapest and budget to entry level laptops
Acer TravelMate – Lightweight portable business laptops
Acer Aspire One – Mid to high-end personal laptop
Acer Extensa – Their mid level to high end office business laptop
Acer Swift – Mid to high-end portable notebooks
Acer Nitro – Entry to mid-end gaming laptops
Acer Predator – Mid to high-end gaming laptops

item.content:encoded:
Xiaomi is a consumer electronics and smart manufacturing firm with an IoT platform that connects smartphones and smart gear.

Xiaomi Corporation was established in Beijing in April 2010 and went public on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange’s Main Board on July 9, 2018.

The company works in its early days with objective to provide electronic items at fair costs so that everyone can benefit from cutting-edge technology.

Xiaomi is a top smartphone manufacturer around the world. In the fourth quarter of 2021, the company’s market share in terms of smartphone shipments was ranked third, with Xiaomi devices available in over 100 countries and regions worldwide.

The company made the Fortune Global 500 list for the third time in August 2021, placing 338th, up 84 places from 2020.

Their logo “MI” stands for “Mobile Internet.” They said it can also mean different things, like “Mission Impossible,” because Xiaomi had to overcome many problems that seemed impossible at the start of their business.

The first official Mi Store in the Philippines launched in February 2018, with the long-awaited physical store located on the 4th level of the TriNoma Mall in Quezon City, next to Cinema 5. They have since opened Mi shops, kiosks and service centers in majority of malls around the country.

In January 2021, Xiaomi partnered with Grimalkin Corporation to create the Mi online shop in the Philippines.

Xiaomi has the Mi, Redmi and Pocophones under its main brand.

Aside from smartphones, Xiaomi also offers tablets, laptops, powerbanks, earphones, headphones, smart TVs, smart watches, smart air purifiers, vacuum cleaners, electric scooter, and home security cameras.

The post 55 Party List Winning Groups In Election 2022 appeared first on Filipino Guides.
item.content:encoded:
The Commission on Elections (Comelec) announced on Thursday the 55 party-list groups that had won seats in the House of Representatives, giving them a total of 62 seats.

The winning party-list groups will take office at 12 p.m. on June 30, 2022, according to the the National Board of Canvassers (NBOC).

After garnering 2,111,091 votes, the Anti-Crime and Terrorism Community Involvement and Support (ACT-CIS) obtained three seats in the 19th Congress.

The second through sixth-placed groupings, 1-Rider Partylist, Tingog, 4PS, Ako Bicol, and Sagip, will each get two seats.

Meanwhile, in the distribution of party-list seats, the following groups will each have one seat:

  • Anakalusugan
  • Marino
  • BHW
  • OFW
  • Duterte Youth
  • Ang Probinsyano
  • Magsasaka
  • API

item.content:encoded:
Vivo Communication Technology or styled as “vivo”, is a Chinese multinational technology company with headquarters in Dongguan, Guangdong.

It designs and develops smartphones, smartphone accessories, software, and online services.

Vivo is a self-contained corporation that creates its own products. The firm creates software for its phones, which it sells through its V-Appstore, with iManager incorporated into their Android-based operating system, Funtouch OS in the global market and Origin OS in Mainland China and India.

Vivo has expanded to more than 100 countries since its inception in 2009. In 2014, the company began expanding internationally. Vivo stated in October 2020 that it would begin selling its goods in Europe.

Vivo signed a sponsorship contract with FIFA in June 2017 to become the official smartphone brand of the FIFA World Cups in 2018 and 2022. The company also made a deal with UEFA to become an official partner of the UEFA Euro 2020 and UEFA Euro 2024 tournaments.

item.content:encoded:
TECNO mobile is a premium smartphone from device manufacturer Transsion.

The TECNO smartphone’s tagline is “Stop At Nothing,” dedicating their brand in unlocking the greatest modern technologies that are progressive in global emerging markets. They intend to provide elegantly designed smart products that excite users to discover a world of possibilities.

They tapped into the affordable markets, delivering localized innovations and design breakthroughs particular in a region.

TECNO’s product portfolio includes smartphones, tablets, smart wearables, and AIoT devices for consumers in more than 70 emerging countries around the world.

Manchester City, the Premier League Champions in 2020-21, has TECNO as an official partner.
